intro: Verticordia apecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and vivid red or pink floral spikes. The plant typically grows in heathlands and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. It is known for its seasonal blooms, often appearing in late winter to early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
